intro: Polygala vulgaris, commonly known as the common milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense spikes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Polygala vulgaris is adapted to a variety of soil types and can thrive in both sunny and partially shaded environments.
